articles.title: Rate Cuts, Meltups, And Market Euphoria - Ed Yardeni Says It's 1999 All Over Again
articles.description: The Fed is expected to lower rates again this year, but with strong economy and Fed's easing, stock market may reach unsustainable highs.
articles.content:
The Fed is set to lower interest rates again this year, but according to Ed Yardeni, the economy doesn't need the help—and the result could be a stock market meltup reminiscent of the late 90s tech frenzy.
In a note shared Monday, Yardeni said he's t... [3118 chars]

articles.title: Top economist on the economy’s dirty truth: The only people who feel good are ‘making over $200,000’ and ‘have large stock portfolios’
articles.description: Diane Swonk, chief economist at KPMG, sees a “creep instead of a surge” in inflation. Things are uneasy below the surface.
articles.content:
The veteran economist says the economy “looks better than it feels” because the very data used to measure it is eroding, and the illusion of resilience could shatter heading into the fourth quarter.

articles.description: Affluent households continue to do the bulk of the spending in the U.S. economy, which is boosting the profits of premier luxury brands like Louis Vuitton.

articles.title: Morgan Stanley's profit beats estimates on boost from dealmaking, stock trading
articles.description: Morgan Stanley's third-quarter profit beat market expectations as investment bankers brought in more fees from advising on deals and by underwriting stock and debt sales, lifting revenue to a record.
articles.content:
Shares of the bank rose 3.6% in premarket trading on Wednesday. They have gained 23.6% this year as of the last closing price.

articles.title: Timber companies PotlatchDeltic and Rayonier announce merger
articles.description: PotlatchDeltic and Florida-based timberland real estate investment trust Rayonier said Tuesday they will merge in an all-stock deal valued around $8.2 billion including debt, creating the second-largest publicly traded timber company in North America.
